alert.note: Alert for Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:20PM EST until January 10 at 2:09PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Virginia, including the following counties, Amelia, Chesterfield, Cumberland, Goochland, Hanover, Henrico, Louisa and Powhatan. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Powhatan, Goochland, Ashland, Moseley, Hadensville, Tuckahoe, Cartersville, Amelia Courthouse, Randolph Macon College, Columbia, Oilville, Sabot, Manakin, Gum Spring, Macon, Wyndham, Montpelier, Trenholm, Fife and Chula. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
